title: Pharmactist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview screening followed by in person interview to meet various pharmacists, including staff and management. Also are able to tour the work environment. Experience and scenario questions are covered.
Interview Questions: Tell me about an accomplishment you are most proud

title: Cerner Clinic Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Very nice interviewers nice talk about the company's culture and team culture and of course your self-introduction and the project you did / which model you used to predict / what was your sesult
Interview Questions: Why do you want to choose WakeMed?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Mainly I think it was just me. I wasn’t able to get my words out correctly because I was so nervous and anxious. Guess my nerves cost me the job because they sent an email saying I didn’t get the job and I was still in the interview
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stressful situations

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: It was the typical interview. Behavior questions and unit tour. I had to shadow. It was the normal process. I heard back a few days later via email and then got the call from HR shortly after.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous work experience.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was so nice and helpful with any questions I had. Good, clean hospital and I will continue to try and work there. Even though they were really busy they all still managed to keep their cool and get the job done while still being nice and helpful.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself?

title: Phlebotomy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: interview was great, i treated it more like a conversation instead of an interview, you won't just be interviewing with one person but 3-5 people depending. They will want you to preform order of draw and explain and show how blood cultures work. They will show you the lab and maybe take you on the floor to see how it works there but overall if you prepare and come with confidence and treat it more like a conversation you won't have a problem! good luck!
Interview Questions: show how to order of draw

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Informal, questions mainly on teamwork. Good teamwork and no matter what the obstical patients come first. The feeling is that we can train clinical skills but not attitude or careeter.
Interview Questions: They very. It's important to put patients first and teamwork is a must.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Interview took approximately 4 hours with back to back meetings with various staff. Conversational and somewhat low key, a lot of repetitive mostly “getting to know you” or “what would you do in this situation” questions
Interview Questions: What interests you in this speciality?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: after a month of applying, finally get a call for an interview where i spoke with manager for a bit, then scheduled for an in person interview a week later.  Got an offer on the spot.  Process was easy going, but the actual hiring process seems to take longer.  We'll see
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself please

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview process. Hear back from HR with an offer within a few days. Interview was via WebEx. HR was friendly and timely. Overall I had a really good experience!
Interview Questions: Tell me about the sickest patient you have taken care of?

title: Registered Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: It was completed virtually due to Covid protocols. It included conversations with multiple staff members and included an overview of the position as well as what their hopes were for that role.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your story career-wise.

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview was conducted first. Qualified candidates were then invited in for on site interview. It was a very positive experience talking with team members and members of management followed by a tour of the facilities.
Interview Questions: What attracted you to acute care?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty standard. After the interview, we toured the unit and spoke with current employees in my position, which I thought was very insightful.   I was interviewed by all the managers for the unit at the same time.
Interview Questions: What is an example of how you showed leadership?

title: Health Information Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Easy remote interview that took around 15 minutes. Basic questions about experience were asked and my interest in the company. I was called 3 days later with an offer. It was overall a very good experience.
Interview Questions: What interests you about WakeMed?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really simple and casual. They make you feel good and comfortable. It was done with a lot of respect. I will be applying again for a Health Educator Specialist position in the near future.
Interview Questions:
What experience do you have?
What is the next step in your career?

title: Nurse Pracitioner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: The amount of time after submitting an application to being contacted by the department was lengthy.  The initial phone call from the hiring manager was informative and led to an in-person interview in less than a week.  The process overall was straightforward and easy.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen from hiring manager, then another interview with a panel with supervisor and the team lead on the floor. Overall, pretty smooth. HR contacted me shortly after with an offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at WakeMed?

title: Senior Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Zero. You'll never get past their "AI" if you don't meet whatever specific requirements their HR setup during the process to fill out an application. Even if you have 90% of the requirements miss just one and it immediately kicks you out and sends you a "thanks but no thanks" email. Yet they continue to advertise the same position over and over and over and over.
Interview Questions: AI is a joke. Don't waste your time.

title: Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: It was about an hour with 2 people n the phone interview with someone else then now I guess I wait until I am called or get an email from hr department
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: BI Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: First phone interview then virtual interview for about 30 minutes. It went smoothly. The Director and Manager( interviewer)  are very nice. They asked about technical question about job related like BI tools and skills, etc.
Interview Questions: tell me about you and what do you do in your free time?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Overall it was a positive experience. Met in person with three team members. Got a tour of the unit after the interview. The team members were very nice and personable.
Interview Questions: Please describe your clinical experiences.

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: No social distancing. I was very quick and brief. I was a little nervous but overall I thought I did well.  Only a couple of hours later, I checked the status of my other applications and the status for that job stated I was not selected. I was surprised that they made the decision so quick, hopefully it's a glitch in the system
Interview Questions: I did not get an offer that soon. It just happened. But they asked me to tell them about myself. Why that particular location

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Zoom Panel with up to 10 people asking questions in regard to certain positions. The panel consists of different staffing members that each will question the recipient for the position offered.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work in the ED over any other department?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter to schedule an interview. I had a 1-1 interview with the unit manager. The setting was calm and an opportunity to get to know each other.
Interview Questions: Why did you want to work at Wakemed

title: Mesical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: It was good, it didnt take long. It was a good interview they just ask the basic questions that every company asks. Tell me about yourself, where do you see your self in five year
Interview Questions: Why do u want to work here

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: I was asked questions about how to deal with difficult situations.  How to diffuse conflict.  Where I saw myself in several years time.  What types of things I look for in a job and employer.
Interview Questions: How do I deal with conflict

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through WakeMed website, contacted by phone 3 days later to schedule an interview with Nurse Manager. The interview was scheduled for the following Monday at my request. The nurse manager was out of the office, so I met with one of the Nurse Supervisors. The face-to-face interview took about 2 hours, including a unit tour and a short shadow opportunity with a current staff member in a similar role. I was given a clear expectation of what to expect from HR and a good idea of what to expect if an offer was made. 7 days after the interview, an HR representative called me to extend the verbal offer and explain the onboarding process.
Interview Questions: Why do want to work at WakeMed?

title: Patient Accounts Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Received email from hiring manager for interview about a month after applying. First interview was pretty basic with hiring supervisor.  Was asked to come back for a second interview before panel of nurses, admin and staff. Pretty basic and laid back. Felt that it went well. I’ve worked in hospital for over 20 yrs so I felt confident. Then received email about a week later that I was not chosen. Frustrating that a person does not call you back and let you know why you weren’t considered. I believe it’s my age.
Interview Questions: One word to describe yourself.

title: Certified Nurse Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was to the point and the managers I interviewed with were very nice. It lasted about 15 minutes. I was able to shadow a nurse tech afterward. It has been over 2 weeks though and I have not heard anything back. I contacted HR and I am still in the interview phase but just waiting. I feel like at this point they should have let me know something though.
Interview Questions: Why do I want this position

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview with hiring manager. Behavioral based interview questions. Gave me an expected time frame for hearing back. Spoke with potential team members. Took a tour of the facility I would be working at. Had plenty of time for questions and hiring manager made themself available outside of interview for further questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a coworker

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed July 2, 2019 the interview was great. I studied interview questions on Google and I A's it in the interview. I received a phone and was hired July 9, 2019. I began work on July 26, 2009. Hallelujah! Thank you, Jesus!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Fuquay-Varina, NC) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied to a posting online, received a call from the hiring manager within a week of application. Interview was set up for the following week. Second phone interview with clinical educator happened the following week. Offer was made by HR the following day.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Very easy not a long wait.  Heard back immediately with an offer.  The application on line is annoying but I just submitted my resume and was called in less than a week after submission. They are flexible with times interview and hiring process.
Interview Questions: The biggest thing is having relatable job experience.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Called for interview a week later. Had interview 4 weeks after called to schedule. Interviewed with a staff nurse, two clinical educators and the hiring manager. Asked a lot of questions.
Interview Questions:
Why WakeMed? 
What can you bring to the team?
Tell me about a time that you had to make a decision that wasn't the best?
What is something that you need to work on?
Tell me about a time that you was in a group and someone was not pulling their weight. What did you do?
Tell me about a time when someone asked you to do something that was out of your scope of practice?

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Cary, NC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: the interview processes in Cary was not a good experience there were a lot of exam type questions asked.  over all the work environment that was described did not sound like a place I would like to work. ……………… …...……….. .     ...……….. ………….. ......…… …...………. …… . . . . ..  . ..   . . it was okay
Interview Questions: exam questions

title: ECG Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process was really quick & simple, the question was really straight to the point , I felt really comfortable. After the interview I went to speak to two people that worked there and I asked them questions about the job.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you ?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy, I just had one phone interview and that was it. They mainly were interested in Bilingual people and those with EPIC software experience.  It was at a time where the department needed PARs.
Interview Questions: Do you have EPIC experience?

title: MLS II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I got a phone call from the manager then scheduled a skype interview  which took about 30 minutes. I got an offer over the phone about 10 days later
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: it takes 30 minutes up to one hour you will meet with department manger and several other employees and they all might ask you random questions concerning your experiences, andwork history and knowledge of the job and how you feel about certain situations that might happen
Interview Questions: work experinced

title: Patient Registration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Group of coworkers interview me. Alot of laugher going on. They already knew who they wanted to hire in that postiton. Friends over experience.  Alot of joking going on n talking about the other person they interviewed n like.
Interview Questions: What could I offer to the job?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (West Raleigh, NC) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the website and was called in for an interview, the interview was very basic, she explained the different duties, the code of conduct and the various things about the department specifically. I got to also shadow a current employee on the floor to get to know the department more. It was a good process
Interview Questions: Describe a challenging time at work and how you handled it.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very laid back but professional. They didn’t make you feel stressed. It took about 30 minutes today and we discussed previous positions and how I would make a nice addition to WakeMed. The staff was very welcoming.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: CNA I Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Cary, NC)
Interview Descriptions: After first going through hR, Meet with the Nurse Manager for 30 minutes and then was given a chance to interview people already in the position to get to know the floor.  After that, had to have a medical screening, drug test, stress test, breathing test for ventilator in case of a pt with active TB- from first interview to last - it took a total of 3 months before i was on board.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Executive Director RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Phone interview as I am relocating to NC from PA.  Offered job immediately.  The nurse recruiter was incredibly helpful and all of my paperwork for orientation (in August) is already done.
Interview Questions: Questions confirming the experience on my resume

title: AP Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Temp to Perm.  Very simple interview.  Not many relevant questions asked. Was told there would be many opportunities for advancement, which was untrue.  A recruiter I met said she had the perfect job and set it up.  The biggest issue was they were not willing to meet my pay requirements, but promised future growth.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with sql?

title: Paramedic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Asked a lot of general questions like why you want to be a paramedic and why you have chosen wake. Test, scenarios, and panel interview. Not very difficult and just be yourself.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about a difficult situation?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: 1:1 interview with questions about handling conflict with peers, physicians, departments. Asked about walking report experience. Discussed the types of patients. Interview was very relaxed and conversation mutually flowed. They stressed that they have education requirements and if you don't hold a BSN you have to obtain within 5 years.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Chaplain Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: My personal history and interest if CPE and faith based ministries. We discussed what CPE was and how it is education and train to become a hospital chaplain. Questions included a discussion of my background.
Interview Questions: My background and work history.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: HR processing takes 2 months. An online behavior assessment will be completed first. Then, the unit manager schedules face to face interview. Interview is behavior assessment as well and job experience and description.
Interview Questions: How to deal a stressful job?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: staff panel interviews followed by management interviews, observation of work area, shadowed a co worker for a few hours to get an idea of work flow. able to talk to other staff members and ask questions about the job. get an idea of work atmosphere and working conditions. got a tour of the facility and introductions to various employees and departments.
Interview Questions: are you flexible with scheduling?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Case scenarios.  How well you work with others.  Do you have a current certification in CNA and CPR?  Worst thing about you.  Best thing about you.  Best learning style.  Work/Life balance.  Favorite hobby.
Interview Questions: Favorite hobby

title: CNA I/Clinical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Cary, NC) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got a call a month after I applied for a phone interview. Then, scheduled an interview with the manager and shadowed a tech for 2 hours. The following week I called HR because it was taking too  long to hear back from them. I got an offer by that phone call.
Interview Questions: Why would I be a good fit?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: Applied online..- status changed to routed to hiring manager.. Week later..,Then received call for interview week later- one week  later interviewed with two very nice ladies ask normal behavior questions and job related inquiries...Went really well..-check my application status two days later.. Stated offer being developed .. Waited on recruiter to call with offer and accepted 3 days later ..feeling excited.. I'm going to work for WakeMed..
Interview Questions: Normal behavioral questions..

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online but didn't hear anything. Was moving from out of state and called HR to alert them of an upcoming visit for a potential interview. The manager for women's health called me within a day to schedule the interview and I shadowed on the floor for 2 hours first. I then met with 3 of the supervisors and they asked me character based questions and questions about my nursing experience. Most of the interview was spent listening to the manager tell me about how the unit functions. It was a low stress interview and I was offered a position shortly after that.
Interview Questions: What was your most memorable patient?

title: Float Pool Pediatric Specialties Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant. Easy. Nothing overly stressful. Only set back is that once offered the position, the hospital only has system wide hospital orientation offered once a month and with limited seats open. I was offered the job but could not start until 6 weeks later.  With a hospital system so large, system wide hospital new employee orientation should be offered more often with more seats available.
Interview Questions:
1. How much I wanted to work.
2. What makes me want to work in the Pediatric Specialty at WakeMed.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: You complete a phone interview with the department first and than move onto an in-person interview if you make the next level. The process after the first and sometimes second interviews can take a while. Next is the background check and drug and alcohol screenings. The whole process took over two months to hire.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to this position?

title: IS Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: There is a panel with members of the team you would be joining. Questions weren't too hard. There was one person who kept interrupting the interview by answering emails and phone calls. I found that to be very rude. The panel were all guys and it was not hard to get them distracted. So I was pretty confident I was going to get the job.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult customer?

title: CNA I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quick and easy. They basically asked me why I wanted the job and if I was ok with having over 20 patients alone at night. I agreed and then I was basically offered the position
Interview Questions: Are you ok with having 20 patients at night?

title: Clinical Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough and good follow-up
Interview Questions: How do you best fit into our culture

title: EMT Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and included an employee referral. I received a call about a week later for an interview. During the interview, you take a short test to assess your knowledge, then meet with the hiring manager, and finally have a panel interview with the operations manager, supervisor, and a few EMTs. They'll ask the standard interview questions. They make you feel very comfortable, so try not to stress.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you went above and beyond the call of duty.

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, panel interview with supervisor and 4 employees. Very easy interview, process was quite easy, and non formal.
Interview Questions: very general questions nothing was too hard or unexpected. Asked how I work on teams as opposed to independently. How I prioritize competing priorties?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Cary, NC) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was not a "Target" oriented interview.  It was relaxed and was with two management personnel.  Unlike the "target" format, where you are in front of a panel, similar to a firing squad, Wake takes a more personal approach, allowing the interviewee to discuss their background and experiences versus set pointed question with an immediate answer.
Interview Questions: Why did you want to leave ***** ?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with the department supervisor and manager.  It was pleasant and relaxed.  Questions were job related, career goals, and expectations of self, staff and management.  I was given a tour of the department, and relating to the supervisor about the instrumentation used which was similar to past experiences.
Interview Questions: Describe the different clinical analyzers that you have used recently.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very long. It took about a month total. Once you apply they call you to set up a phone screen, then if they like you during the phone screen, they'll have you come in for a face to face interview. You will interview with multiple people then if you're chose, someone from HR will call you with an offer.
Interview Questions: What are your long term goals with the company.

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview with Supervisor and manager. They look over my resume and told me about the position. What the hours are and what they expected. Talk about GE program they used. Ask have I work in that system?
Interview Questions: What type of person are you? How well you work under pressure?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was great, went very smoothly; very personable. Applied in October; interviewed mid-January.  Took 3 months but the start date is in February, so it wasn't too bad.  Got an offer on the spot.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell me about a time you provided patient care and thought maybe you could have done something differently?

title: CNA I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Came in waited for about 10 min, met with HR Manager. She went over my resume, asked me some questions about work history and how to do common CNA duty procedures.
Interview Questions: Why do you think we should hire you?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: easy, very nice ladies that inteviewed me. They will ask you questions about your insurance background as far as if you know how to file hospital claims and if you know the process of doing so. They asked me which one I wanted to work, Medicare or Medicaid and my resume spoke for itself.
Interview Questions: None really, just know your medical background in all insurances

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Cary, NC) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a bit intimidating because a group of people interviewed me but it was also a very positive experience. The questions were very relevant and to the point and the answers I provided were perfect. I feel they were very competent interviewers because they all knew exactly the kind of employee they were looking for and I felt when I left the interview that I got the job.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation in which the patient didn't speak english?

title: Nurse Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Phone Call from Department Manager
Interviewed - Completed Forms at Interview
Phone Call from HR within one week for Job Offer
Orientation is one week and they schedule monthly (you need to be available 8-4 Mon-Thu)
Interview Questions: Behavioral Style Questions

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Raleigh, NC) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: costumer service question. How do I feel about taking out the trash?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at WakeMed Health and Hospitals (Cary, NC) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: Overall I was pleased with the interviewing process. I was most frustrated with the fact that I was told that they would be making a decision by the end of the next week and I was not given a decision for six weeks! This was my second time interviewing at this institution and it is extremely difficult to get in. Good Luck!
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in your career that involved conflict and how did you handle it?
